fr.umlv.wallj.pathfinding

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.wallj.pathfinding.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A node represents a grid's cell during the A* algorithm. It contains informations about the node : \n The x is the node abscissa. The y is the node orderly. The cost is the cost to go from the start node to the current node. The previous is the previous player's position according the current node. The heuristicCost is the theoric cost to go from start node to the arrival node. The heuristicCost is the sum of cost and distance between the current node and the arrival.
    Author:
    Severin Gosset - Denis Biguenet

      • shortestWay

        public static Path shortestWay(Board b,
                               Node start,
                               Node arrival)
        Applies the A* algorithm to go from the start node to the arrival node. The player can't move on a occupied cell (except the cell containing a bomb). If the player want to go in the unreachable cell, the A* fails and the player stays on his cell.
        Parameters:
        b - the current level.
        start - the node where we are.
        arrival - the arrival node.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList correspond to the better path between start and arrival.
